availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Batts (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Amanda Crimn Batts. Father of Parthenia Batts, Asa Batts, Sarah Batts, James Batts, Joseph Batts, Margaret Ann Batts, John Thomas Batts, Nancy Ann Batts, Millard Minvard Batts, and Amanda A. Batts. Famer in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed James Perry as a laborer in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 382A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 259.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 9996.
